comments:
Running the JDT debug test suite, I got what appears to be a random failure:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[120]: java.net.SocketException: socket 
closed
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketAccept(Native Method)
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.accept(PlainSocketImpl.java:353)
	at java.net.ServerSocket.implAccept(ServerSocket.java:439)
	at java.net.ServerSocket.accept(ServerSocket.java:410)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketTransportImpl.accept
(SocketTransportImpl.java:84)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketListeningConnectorImpl.accept
(SocketListeningConnectorImpl.java:123)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMDebugger$ConnectRunnable.run
(StandardVMDebugger.java:77)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:536)

For some reason, the connection to the target VM could not be established due 
to a "socket closed" exception. Jed, do you have any ideas on how this might 
happen?

The test being run in this case was:

testDisabledModification(org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.core.WatchpointTests)

I don't have any "real" insight into this.

Is the code that closes the ServerSocket multithreaded?  Maybe we're
pre-emptively closing the ServerSocket.  Possibly in a case where an exception
is thrown and a finally block closes the ServerSocket?

I've never heard of sockets closing themselves, so...
have not seen this in a long time.
